perturbation.original_text:
1. EXTENSION OF TERM: The first paragraph of Section 4 of the Agreement is hereby deleted in its entirety and replaced with the following:
  “TERM: The rights granted hereunder shall be effective as of the Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2006 (the “Term”); provided,however, that with respect to each Property, including Robots, Kingdom of Heaven, Mr. and Mrs. Smith, In Her Shoes, Idiocracy (Oww My Balls) andIce Age II, all right and licenses granted herein will continue in full force and effect until March 31, 2008.”
perturbation.changed_text:
1. EXTENSION OF TERM: The first paragraph of Section 4 of the Agreement is hereby deleted in its entirety and replaced with the following:
  “TERM: The rights granted hereunder shall be effective as of the Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2006 (the “Term”); provided, however, that with respect to each Property, including Robots and Kingdom of Heaven, all right and licenses granted herein will continue in full force and effect until March 31, 2008.” For all other properties, including Mr. and Mrs. Smith, In Her Shoes, Idiocracy (Oww My Balls) and Ice Age II, the term will extend only if mutually agreed upon in writing by both parties 30 days prior to December 31, 2006.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly defines the term for all listed properties. The modified text introduces a different condition (mutual written agreement) for some properties, creating a contradiction regarding how the term 'Term' applies to those specific properties. This creates uncertainty as to the expiration date of licenses for Mr. and Mrs. Smith, In Her Shoes, Idiocracy (Oww My Balls) and Ice Age II, requiring external agreement to determine their license term beyond December 31, 2006, unlike Robots and Kingdom of Heaven.

perturbation.original_text: 2. NOTICE PROVISION: The notice information for Licensee in Section 17(a) of the Agreement shall be amended such that “Paul Zuzelo” is deletedand replaced with “General Counsel”, and such that the email address for Paul Zuzelo is deleted.
perturbation.changed_text: 2. NOTICE PROVISION: The notice information for Licensee in Section 17(a) of the Agreement shall be amended such that “Paul Zuzelo” is deleted and replaced with “General Counsel”, and such that the email address for Paul Zuzelo is deleted. However, if the General Counsel is unavailable, notices can be sent to Paul Zuzelo at his personal email address.
perturbation.explanation: The original text removes Paul Zuzelo from the notice provision. The modified text then reintroduces him, but with a contingency ('if the General Counsel is unavailable'). This creates a contradiction: Section 17(a) specifies that official notice should go to 'General Counsel', but this amendment allows sending notice to Paul Zuzelo under certain conditions. This ambiguity complicates the process of delivering legal notices, causing confusion on valid notice procedure.
